conversations.content: Let me work here! I beseech you!
Er... Refresh my memory. Who're you, again?
Why, I am the Child of Miracles— she whose hands will sculpt a world where humans and dragons can live in harmony!
Aha! Now I remember. But, uh... Wasn't your country trying to ERADICATE dragons?
In the past, yes. But I seek to change the perception that dragons are our enemies.
You need not concern yourself with my title or position right now, though.
Please just call me Amane—for you will be my superior while I am working here.
You're really set on this, aren't you? Why would someone of your station want to work here, of all places?
Circumstances have led to my country adopting many a child-turned-orphan in the wake of draconic conflict.
And I, seeing something of my own sordid past in their plight...
...suggested that we ought to give them sweets to assuage their aching hearts. My countrymen rebutted, arguing it to be an unnecessary luxury.
Fie, I say. I know from my own experience just how much sweets can raise one's spirits in life's darkest hours.
Thus, I have come to earn the money I need to treat them to such pleasures.
I know exactly how much money I need— and I won't give up until I've earned it!
You've got determination in spades, if nothing else! How did the others back home react to the idea?
At first, they tried to stop me...but after witnessing the intensity of my resolution, they agreed to support my decision!
...Even they couldn't stop you, huh.
Well, you won't hear me complaining!
This is our busiest season of the year, and since I can't magically sprout an extra pair of hands, you've come at the perfect time.
You'll hire me, then?!
Gladly! I think I have a spare uniform that's exactly your size, too.
Let me see if I can find it and make a few tweaks. If you're still on board after that, the job's yours!
Bring it on!
This...wasn't what I expected.
Hee hee. Well? Is it cute, or what? I think this design will really suit you!
I-I appreciate the bid of confidence, but... Isn't it a bit twee for a woman of 24?
I'm not opposed to cutesy aesthetics, but I can't help but feel it's not very age-appropriate.
People can be cute at any age! And being cute gives a big morale boost, thereby improving customer satisfaction.
It's called ＂dressing for success,＂ and I'm a huge proponent of it!
I see. Well, I'm convinced!
Hee hee. Glad to hear it! Starting today, this restaurant shall be known as the Kitty Cafe!
And you shall be its shining star— its meowning glory!
Hrk! The pressure...!
But pressure gives birth to brilliant diamonds, and I shall shine bright! Business shall boom most miraculously!
Now that's what I like to hear! Let the success story...begin!
Indeed!
Can I get one of these?
Of course—but are you sure that's ALL you want? Our skewers and fried fish are second to none!
Oh, uh... I'm actually not that hungry, so...
There's no need to be shy! I haven't even gotten started on how good our seafood soup is, or our fresh salads and desserts...
Hold on, Amane!
You can't be excessively pushy with customers! You're going to drive them away!
*sigh* Can you go finish the soup in the kitchen instead? I'll handle taking orders.
The recipe is next to the pot. Got it?
I-I'm sorry... I will go and do just that.
Hm. I've never seen this dish before. First I have to ＂strain＂ it—whatever that means—and then add three teaspoons of salt and some vinegar to spice it up.
I don't know how much the recipe means by ＂some,＂ but I imagine that the vinegar is the star ingredient here, so let's go wild! Take this: Miraculous Vinegar Splash!
Oof. That's a pretty pungent aroma.
Amane! What IS that smell? ...Oh no!
Argh! I've been slow-cooking that soup since this morning! Here, let me fix it.
All right. But what should I do next?
Well, since you struck out in both the dining room and the kitchen, how about you just wash those dishes for me?
Understood! Then, once they're clean, I'll dry them with my wind magic!
Er... I probably should've set the dial to ＂spring breeze＂ rather than ＂cyclone.＂
Oh NO! Why are all the dishes broken?!
*sigh* Somehow, hiring you has actually made MORE work for me around here.
I-I'm sorry to be such a nuisance...
I only wanted to help, but I'm liable to drive the Kitty Cafe under at this rate.
Perhaps I was a fool to think I could do anything for the children back home.
Don't beat yourself up, Amane.
I won't deny that your ＂assistance＂ has done more harm than good around here...
Ugh! Am I truly that bad at this?
I'm afraid I'd be better off asking an actual cat to help out, opposable thumbs or not. But you have what matters most of all— the right mindset for the job.
What do you mean?
You're trying to make people happy.
You may have stumbled...a LOT...but all your failures come from a genuine attempt to make everyone happy, right?
As long as you keep a positive attitude, the rest will come in time. Don't give up!
Yes... Yes! I am the Child of Miracles, after all! If anyone can do this, it's me!
I WILL make this cafe successful, come what mew! ...Er, may!
That's the spirit! I'll have you up to speed on both cooking and serving customers before the day is done. Let's get cracking!
Yes, ma'am!
In an effort to raise money for impoverished children suffering in her home country, Amane picked up a new job at Nina's beachside cafe. Things were finally looking up after a rocky start.
Could I trouble you for a moment, Master?
Uh-oh. Am I about to hear your resignation speech?
On the contrary—I was actually mulling over a way to improve my performance. Would it be possible to close shop for a day and go see how a rival cafe is run?
I've been thinking long and hard on how to make the Kitty Cafe more successful...
...and concluded that there must be something I can learn from our competitors.
Huh. That's actually a really good idea! I'm in. How's today sound?
Like, TODAY today?
Of course! We don't have any reservations today, so there's no better time. Let's go!
Excuse me! More of this miraculous grub, please! I'll take this, this... Oh, and this!
Certainly!
You must be really hungry.
So many of these dishes are completely foreign to me. I can't help myself!
Er, I think everything you ordered is pretty standard beachside fare...
Fascinating. I have little experience with places like these, so I had no idea.
My country doesn't border the sea, and I was always too busy with my duties to go elsewhere.
Really?! Then you've never split a watermelon on the beach?
I have not.
Or played beach flags? Or gone diving? Or done any of the other seaside staples?
Never. My duties of serving as the country's representative and listening to its people's concerns allowed no time for leisure.
Every international excursion I made was on official business.
You've had such a rough go of things, yet you're working tirelessly to make life better for all those children...
*sniff* My heart! Okay, Amane—eat as much as you want today. It's all on me!
Are you sure?!
Positive. We're off the clock today, so we may as well let our hair down.  Just don't forget that this is supposed to be a learning experience, too.
Worry not, Master. My focus is absol— Ah, Waitress! I have another order!
Master! What are those? I spy food, various tchotchkes, and even games!
Those are stalls. Unlike the Kitty Cafe, you patronize these while standing—and as you can see, they come in all kinds.
How fascinating! Might I try that one?
Er, I'm not sure what throwing rings has to do with the Kitty Cafe, so—
Just for a minute! Please!
All right, fine. Just for a minute.
Thank you, Master!
I've never seen her move so quickly...
But I can understand her enthusiasm if this is all new to her.
Experiencing these fun activities firsthand should help her find new ways to keep our customers engaged, I suppose.
Ha ha! No game can vex the Child of Miracles, no matter how novel. Watch as I seize victory!
What?! I missed every single one?
What a shame. Still, you're always welcome to come try again! Here's a little something to say thanks for playing.
Wow, you get a balloon even if you lose? Such generosity!
Onward! The next stall awaits!
Okay, maaaybe she's getting a tad overzealous.
Amane! Once you're done there, how about we take five?
But there is so much I need to study! I can't afford to waste time.
You're liable to give yourself heat stroke if you keep running around like that.
Pffft. A little heat won't bother me. I can simply conjure a gust of wind to cool off.
So—
Amane!
Are you all right? Let me touch your forehead... You're boiling hot!
Urgh... I can handle a fever... The Child of Miracles cannot be worrying her people—
This is no time to be acting tough. You need to see a doctor immediately!
M-my apologies for the trouble, Master.
I'm just glad you're all right. You had me scared half to death!
I understand why you're excited about experiencing things for the first time, but you don't need to run at full throttle.
Yes. I see the error of my ways now.
I must say, I can hardly believe the sheer variety of seaside activities out there.
I thought myself above such single-mindedness...
...but my actions today clearly demonstrated that I have much to learn.
It's okay. Making a mistake the first time you do something is perfectly normal. The key is learning from the experience.
So what did we learn today, hm?
One lesson immediately comes to mind.
Overexertion is a serious concern when enjoying seaside activities.
We can't have our customers losing themselves so thoroughly in beachy bliss that they end up collapsing.
And I have the perfect countermeasure: We need only make a cool breeze blow through the Kitty Cafe to ensure maximum customer comfort!
I can't argue that the idea has merit, but  I think something like that is beyond us...
Fear not. That is where I come in.
I will create said breeze with my magic!
Can you really do that?
Of course. People do not call me the Child of Miracles for nothing!
After I set some wind mana in motion, the breeze should last a few hours. Then I need only repeat the process.
Well, I'm sold! A feature like that is really going to make us stand out amidst the competition.
You weren't kidding about the whole ＂Child of Miracles＂ thing. Consider me a believer!
THAT'S what it took to make you believe? *sigh* Well, regardless...
Tomorrow, we put our plan into action! Glory to the Kitty Cafe!
Excuse me! I'm ready to order!
Coming!
Excuse me! Is my order ready yet?
J-just about! I apologize for the wait!
Excuse me!
One moment, please!
*pant* Why are we so busy today? That shift was like wading through a minefield.
Ever since I got a cool breeze blowing through here, the cafe's popularity has soared. Which is a good thing, mind you...
...but there is an upper limit to the number of customers I can handle!
Agreed. We can't handle a sustained rush like this with just the two of us—and the cafe's reputation is at stake if we fail.
I refuse to let that happen. Is there nothing we can do? Nowhere we can turn for help?
Looks like you're swamped. Are you hanging in there?
Harmonia Choir Singer Elias
Is that the uniform here, Amane? It's so cute!
Harmonia Choir Singer Pia
Elias! Pia! What brings you two here?
Siren's going to be performing near here tomorrow, and we have tickets to see her.
But when we heard you were helping out at a restaurant in the area, we just HAD to stop by and visit!
Things seem pretty wild here, though. Is there anything we can do to help?
Those words are music to my ears— not that I should be surprised, coming from you!
You'd be doing us a huge favor. Amane, can I leave you in charge of giving them their tasks?
Of course!
So, I would like the two of you to help by taking orders and serving the food.
If you run into any problems, call me and I'll work a little miracle for you!
Wow! You're so dependable, Amane.
Well, I HAVE been here longer than you. Will that work for you, too, Elias?
Sure thing. I'll go start taking orders now.
Great! And always remember: Our number one goal is making our customers happy!
Now, while they're doing that, I need to set out the cutlery to get the tables ready.
Amaaaneee! Heeelp!
She's run into trouble already?! *ahem* I'll be right there!
Amane, what should I do here? This man keeps asking for something weird, and—
There is nothing ＂weird＂ about ordering nostalgia noodles!
But sir, we don't have anything like that on our menu.
Well, you should! Because if I can't have what I came here for, then why did I even make the trip? Hm?!
What should we do? We can't serve something we don't know how to make. Maybe we'd better just ask him to leave.
Absolutely not. What did I just tell you about making our customers smile?
I mean, I didn't forget, but how are we—
We'll just have to try and work out how to make the dish he wants. Fortunately, interpersonal communication is one of my many miraculous abilities.
Could you try and describe these nostalgia noodles for me, sir?
Where to start? It was a famous soba dish served at a restaurant in this very spot when I was a young lad.
I see. What did it taste like? What color was it?
It was a bowl of yellow soba noodles covered in a spicy, sour black sauce.
Mm-hm. Did it contain anything other than noodles and sauce?
Let's see... There were vegetables that I seem to recall being either red or green... Oh, plus a splendid omelet on top!
Understood. Please give us a moment. Elias, Pia, I need you to come with me.
What's the game plan?
I'm going to make the dish he asked for, of course!
Elias, check on the noodles! And Pia, have you cut up the vegetables?
Y-yes! I've got a serving of green and red vegetables ready!
The noodles are boiled and good to go! What else is left?
Now I just need to add the sauce he asked for, and...done! I'll go and take it to him!
Thank you for waiting, sir! Here are the nostalgia noodles you asked for!
I hope they're worth the wait. *munch* *munch* Oh my!
Oh, the memories are all flooding back... This tastes exactly like I remember it!
I can't stop shoveling it down—it's like my chopsticks have a life of their own!
Thank you kindly, young'uns. I am very satisfied indeed. Here's what I owe you.
We're just glad to have made you happy! Take care, sir!
Amane, that was amazing! I can't believe you made that stubborn old man smile!
But how were you able to recreate the dish he was talking about?
He said it was a soba dish, which immediately made me think of Hinomoto.
So I thought back to what I learned about Hinomotoan cuisine from the immigrants living in my country.
I've got a great memory for stuff like that. Even so, I'm still glad I was able to pull it off.
Wow. I'm legitimately impressed.
Ha ha. I've grown a lot since I first came here!
There is no customer I cannot please! I trust I've earned your respect?
And then some!
Ha ha. You've definitely got mine, too. ...Hm?
Oh, a new customer! Welco—
Whoa, a dragon! Well, Amane, here's your chance to flex those customer service skills you're so proud of.
This will be no trouble. So long as it does not seek to harm anyone, a dragon is a customer like any other. Let me just—
Oh!
Raaaaaaaaagh!
No... No... P-please leave!
Urgh! ...It would seem I am not welcome here.
I was hoping to sample the food of this well-reputed restaurant in a land so dear to me... But I see it wasn't meant to be.
Oh no! He's leaving!
*pant* *pant* What... What have I done?
That's what we want to know. It's not like you to suddenly attack a customer.
He... He reminded me of a dragon I wish I could forget.
The one who destroyed my homeland. The second I saw him, my vision went white...
*gasp*
But that dragon is no more. The one who came here just now has done nothing wrong...and yet I drove him away.
I am so ashamed of what I have done!
Business sure is slow today.
More like non-existent. We've had zero customers.
Word must have gotten out about yesterday's...incident.
If customers don't start pouring in by the wagonload, we're going to start hemorrhaging money.
And without income—
Right. I won't be able to pay you.
Gah. Well, pay or no pay, I'm mortified. I'm the one who let my emotions run wild and ousted that dragon from the premises.
I should have known better. Dragons and humans are not so different, after all. Our hearts beat just the same.
I swore an oath to protect one and all from sadness, and yet my actions did just the opposite!
I understand your frustration, Amane, but we need to take action, not wallow in regret.
You speak true. We need to drum up some fresh clientele. Give me a day and I'll have this sorted.
Oh? You have a plan, then?
First, I'll apologize to that dragon. I vow to give him an experience so positive that it makes up for my offense tenfold.
I realize this is a selfish request, but—
Say no more. Regaining customers' trust is a key part of rebuilding our business. I'll be happy to help.
You have my thanks, Master! Let us give him the best welcome we possibly can.
First, we need to decorate the restaurant and prepare a master-class menu... Er, do dragons even eat human food?
We should probably find a dragon to ask.
But we can't just hope a dragon we're on speaking terms with will happen to stroll— wait, I know one I can ask!
Mariti is here to answer your call!
I appreciate you coming on such short notice.
Don't sweat it! It sounds like the choir kids owe you, so I'm happy to repay the favor.
Much obliged. Now, I'd like your opinion.
This is the cuisine I was thinking about serving to a draconic customer of ours. Do you think it'd make him feel welcome?
Wooow... I'm pretty sure I looked up the word ＂luxury＂ in a dictionary once and this was, like, LITERALLY the picture!
Thank you. My master and I devised this recipe after discussing which ingredients would best suit a dragon's palate.
Naturally, dragonfruit is the star here. Best to start with a familiar base.
Iiinteresting. Can't say I've ever met a dragon that DOESN'T like dragonfruit, but...
...aren't you kinda missing the point here?
Explain.
You're not trying to concoct a one-size- fits-all recipe for every dragon ever, are you? Just the dragon you drove away.
I think you should focus more on what HE likes rather than dragons in general.
You're right. Every dragon is unique, just like their human counterparts. I'm almost ashamed I didn't think of that.
My most straightforward route here would be to talk to that dragon directly, but I'm afraid that's not really an option...
Did he say anything before he left? I can't imagine a dragon coming to a human restaurant without a reason.
Now that you mention it—
I was hoping to sample the food of this well-reputed restaurant in a land so dear to me...but I see it wasn't meant to be.
Come to think of it, wasn't there once another restaurant in this very spot?
Perhaps he was nostalgic for the food they used to serve. In which case...
...I'm going to recreate their cuisine! Would you do me the honor of being my designated taste tester, Maritimus?
You don't have to ask me twice!
Aaand it's ready! Dig in.
My tummy is READY! But what is it? It smells kind of spicy!
It's a dish called ＂nostalgia noodles.＂ The previous restaurant in this space was famous for them.
It's clear to me that the dragon still treasures his memories of this area.
We need to respect and embrace those feelings if we want to get on his good side.
You've helped me truly internalize the idea that humans and dragons are one and the same.
Now, sample the savory fruit of my introspection and render your judgment!
Rub-a-dub-dub, thanks for the grub!
Mmm! Okay, yeah, this is gold-star good.
Truly?!
You can really taste the love in every bite!
I'm sure that once he tastes this, that dragon will understand your intentions.
I'll go see if I can rustle him up for you. Gooood luck!
Thank you!
Hello. I'm here at Maritimus's insistence.
Given the abject terror you displayed when I last dropped by, I'm not sure what to expect with today's visit.
Thank you so much for coming! First, let me apologize for being so rude to you the other day.
Your appearance triggered a deep-seated trauma that made me behave irrationally. Truly, it wasn't you—it's me.
I'd like to make it up to you by way of this cuisine. I hope it suits you.
I cannot guarantee you will like it... but would you try it all the same?
Oh! This looks exactly like the dish Simon and I once enjoyed in this very spot.
I would be glad to sample it. *munch* ...Great glutenous gracious!
H-how is it?!
It tastes splendid—and that just makes the kindness you have shown in making it hit home all the more.
I can tell that you genuinely wanted to make up for hurting me, and to give me an experience to remember.
It has been a long time since anyone made me feel so welcome. Thank you.
Thank goodness... I'm so relieved.
I'm not so naive as to think this negates my prior bad behavior towards you, but...
...as an employee of the Kitty Cafe, I live to make my customers happy. Thank you for allowing me the pleasure.
I feel like we're thanking each other in circles here, but I must say, this Kitty Cafe of yours is something special.
I have fond memories of this area from visiting with Simon. I see that the new restaurant has earned its reputation, too. I apologize for ever thinking otherwise.
I hope I will be welcome if I come again.
Oh, absolutely! We would love to have you!
'Scuse me! I'm, like, ready to order!
Can I order, please?
Good afternoo—whoa! There are so many customers! And isn't that Siren?
Erasmus has apparently been doing his own little PR campaign for the Kitty Cafe.
I believe his tagline was: ＂Beachside eats and dragon-approved treats!＂ Guess the word-of-mouth is working!
Yay! I'm so happy for you guys!
Oh, hello. What brings you here today?
It's about time for us to head home, so we figured we should come say goodbye.
Looks like everything here's running more smoothly than a well-hydrated soprano.
It certainly is. Business is booming!
Good luck with everything! I'll be spreading the good word too.
Much obliged! You all were instrumental in our newfound success.
Next time you come, dinner is on the house. Take care on the trip back!
Laa laa laa!
It's been quite the wild ride since I started working here, but I'm finally approaching my savings goal.
At this rate, I should be set before summer ends. I cannot wait to see the children's smiling faces!
Amaneee! We need to talk!
What's wrong? Was there an issue with the end-of-day ledger? A late delivery, maybe?
That's not it. We've actually got a group that wants to book the whole restaurant tomorrow!
Oh! That's certainly new for us. Still, it won't pose a problem.
I am more miraculous than I was at summer's onset—no customer shall go unsatisfied on my watch!
Now that's what I like to hear! You really have changed, Amane. It's apparent in all you do.
You're making me blush, Master. So, where do our customers hail from?
Funny you should ask.
Get this: they're all from the Halidom!
Excuse me! I'm Euden from the Halidom, and I have a reservation.
Whoa! Amane really does work here. Ooh, and check out that uniform. Get it, girl!
Your support means the world. What a pleasant surprise to have you all here.
They are all accompanying me on my vacation, you see. We figured we would drop by since we were in the area.
I see. Well, make yourselves comfortable! Here is the menu.
Kindly summon us once you are ready to order. We will be right with you.
And in the event I have already settled on my order?
You haven't even opened the menu, though.
I needn't, for what I desire is not offered within.
I want you to cook something that will impress me.
Are you certain?! If memory serves, Amane's cooking ability is...questionable.
Indeed. I remember her trying to pass off a purple lump as ＂food＂ in the past.
That was a long time ago! Now as long as I have the master's help, I can cook fine dishes! I have been doing it all summer.
I see. Allow me to amend my order, then. I want you to make something that will impress me WITHOUT assistance.
What?!
Whoa there, Windy. Don't go teasin' her TOO much just 'cause you like her.
I'm with Ranzal. Restaurant staff work hard enough already—we really shouldn't be adding to their stress.
Very well! I accept your challenge, Windwyrm!
Ilia above... This could get messy.
You just watch! I'll show you what I can do!
So that's the story, huh?
Indeed. Still, had I thought it impossible, I wouldn't have accepted the challenge.
After all I've been through, I'm certain I can handle this.
Such confidence. You don't even want a few pointers?
Fear not! You have taught me this menu front-to-back—inside and out.
All I need to do is apply that knowledge to create a unique dish that will please our discerning customer. Trust me, Master.
Then I guess that makes me your cheerleader! You've got this, Amane!
My apologies for the wait, Windwyrm. I assure you, this dish is ALL my own work.
Goodness. That looks superb.
Ha ha. I'm glad you think so! Now, let your tongue be amazed!
Patience, child. Know that I am not easily impressed. Now let us see...
By my scales, this is—!
Mwa ha ha. I hope you weren't expecting a bland meal from ME, of all people!
Behold: a dish made especially for you, based on all I learned of your tastes during my time at the Halidom.
I dub it...my Miraculous Windwyrm Special! Well? What do you think?
It is delicious.
Really?!
Indeed. I expected that your heart would be set on proving me wrong for daring to doubt you...
...but all I can sense from this dish is a genuine desire to please me. I could not be more impressed.
My intention was only to assess how much you have grown since that day you first dared to call me a friend.
The result surpassed my wildest expectations. Your dream of achieving peaceful harmony between humans and dragons is genuine, young Amane.
Hah! But of course! I stand before you as more than just the Child of Miracles—
I am also the Kitty Cafe's shining star! I will stop at nothing to please my guests!
Whew... What a day. I'm glad everyone left happy.
Here I thought we couldn't get any busier, and then today happened. Still, it was fun!
Summer's end is nearly upon us. Which means...
Amane!
Aaah! Wh-what is it, Master? I've finished tidying up and getting everything ready for our next customers.
Hee hee! I come bearing good news.
Here's your pay for the day.
Much obli— WHOA! This is... This is enough to achieve my savings goal! Are you sure?
Of course. You really gave it your all today, so I figured you deserved a little bonus.
Thank you so much, Amane. I've been very fortunate to have you.
I-I should be the one thanking you! My debt to you is profound. But I don't have a moment to waste!
I need to start by buying at least a hundred buckets of the finest custard!
Then a human-sized flan and a MOUNTAIN of chocolate! And a month's worth of cake! Oh, this is going to be GLORIOUS!
Okay, I didn't put THAT much money in the envelope...
What?! You're telling me an entire summer's worth of toil still hasn't earned me enough?
If you think this is enough money for everything you just listed, you've lived a pretty sheltered upbringing, sweetheart.
I-I see. Before I started working here, being the Child of Miracles was the only ＂job＂ I ever had. No matter. I won't give up.
If I can't buy all of the sweets I want to, I'll just have to save money by making them from scratch instead!
I'm sure I can craft the finished products myself with all of my experience— I'll even invite the children to bake them with me! Oh, but I AM a genius.
What a wonderful idea, Amane. You really have grown.
When you first came here, you were wetter behind the ears than a newborn porpoise. Er, if porpoises had ears.  But now? Just look at you.
I owe my transformation to all the fun I had throughout the summer.
I will forever treasure the memory of this fleeting respite from my duties.
When you employed me, you changed my life forever. Thank you, Master.
Hee hee. The pleasure was all mine. Your delight was infectious, after all.
You've already perfected your winning Kitty Cafe smile—now go on and share it with all the children back home!
